sen.j: 楠 小十郎（くすのき こじゅうろう、嘉永元年（1840年）頃? - 元治元年9月26日 (旧暦)（1864年10月26日））は京都出身の新選組隊士である。
sen.e: Kojuro KUSUNOKI (year of birth: ca. 1848 - date of death: October 26, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group which guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) who came from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 嘉永元年: グレゴリオ暦では1848年ですので、そのように表記しています。/新選組隊士: 用語集には「Shinsen-gumi masterless warriors' party」と登録されていますが、この訳語には「隊士」に当たる部分がないため、「新選組」として登録されている用語を基に訳出しました。ただし初出の場合の説明の(a group who…)は(a group which …)に直しました。
sen.e: Kojuro KUSUNOKI (year of birth: ca. 1848 - date of death: October 26, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group which guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) who came from Kyoto.
Kojuro KUSUNOKI (year of birth: ca. 1848 - date of death: October 26, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group which guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) who came from Kyoto.
He was a member of binan goninshu (five men of beauty).
He was a member of binan goninshu (five men of beauty).
He was a member of binan goninshu (five men of beauty).

sen.j: 新選組初期に、長州藩・桂小五郎の命で間者（スパイ）として入隊したとされる。
sen.e: He is said to have joined Shinsengumi in the early days of the group because he was ordered by Kogoro KATSURA from Choshu Domain to act as a spy in the group.
He is said to have joined Shinsengumi in the early days of the group because he was ordered by Kogoro KATSURA from Choshu Domain to act as a spy in the group.
He is said to have joined Shinsengumi in the early days of the group because he was ordered by Kogoro KATSURA from Choshu Domain to act as a spy in the group.

sen.j: 若々しく目がぱっちりした色白下ぶくれの顔であった。
sen.e: He looked young and had a fair-complexioned, full-cheeked face with bright, clear eyes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He looked young and had a fair-complexioned, full-cheeked face with bright, clear eyes.
He looked young and had a fair-complexioned, full-cheeked face with bright, clear eyes.

sen.j: 女のように優しい声をしていたと言われる。
sen.e: He is said to have had such a gentle voice as a woman.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is said to have had such a gentle voice as a woman.
He is said to have had such a gentle voice as a woman.
He called himself a ronin (masterless samurai) of 17 years in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 京都浪人17歳: 定訳不明
sen.e: He called himself a ronin (masterless samurai) of 17 years in Kyoto.
He called himself a ronin (masterless samurai) of 17 years in Kyoto.

sen.j: 元治元年9月26日（1864年10月26日）の濃霧の朝4つ時（1000頃）、新選組屯所の1つとして使われていた前川邸の門前でぼんやりしていた。
sen.e: Around 10 o'clock in the very foggy morning of October 26, 1864, he stood around in front of the gate of Maekawa residence, which was used as a place where Shinsengumi quartered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/新選組屯所: 用語集には「Shinsengumi headquarters」と登録されていますが、「headquarters」は本部を意味し、この文脈に合わないため、「屯所」として登録されている訳語を基に訳しています。
sen.e: Around 10 o'clock in the very foggy morning of October 26, 1864, he stood around in front of the gate of Maekawa residence, which was used as a place where Shinsengumi quartered.
Around 10 o'clock in the very foggy morning of October 26, 1864, he stood around in front of the gate of Maekawa residence, which was used as a place where Shinsengumi quartered.

sen.j: (そのとき)近藤勇より命を受けた原田左之助に背後から斬りつけられた。
sen.e: Then he was cut down from behind by Sanosuke HARADA who was ordered by Isami KONDO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)/
sen.e: Then he was cut down from behind by Sanosuke HARADA who was ordered by Isami KONDO.
Then he was cut down from behind by Sanosuke HARADA who was ordered by Isami KONDO.

sen.j: そのまま水菜畑に逃れた。
sen.e: He escaped to a field where potherb mustards were cultivated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/水菜畑: 定訳不明
sen.e: He escaped to a field where potherb mustards were cultivated.
He escaped to a field where potherb mustards were cultivated.
But he fell dead there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But he fell dead there.
But he fell dead there.

sen.j: その光景を八木家次男・八木為三郎が目撃していたと言う。
sen.e: Tamesaburo YAGI, the second son of the Yagi family, is said to have witnessed the scene.
Tamesaburo YAGI, the second son of the Yagi family, is said to have witnessed the scene.
Tamesaburo YAGI, the second son of the Yagi family, is said to have witnessed the scene.
